Draw random vectors from multivariate Gaussian in canonical form

Source: R/rmvnormcanon.R
rmvnormcanon.Rd

Draw random vectors from multivariate Gaussian in canonical form

rmvnormcanon(n, b, P)

Arguments

n

Number of draws
b

b parameter
P

Precision matrix

Value

matrix with n columns, vector if n=1

Examples

P<-matrix(c(1,.5,.5,1),ncol=2)
b=c(2,0)
# expected value and covariance matrix
Sigma = solve(P)
mu = b%*%Sigma
# sample
x<-rmvnormcanon(1000,b,P)
mu.hat=apply(x,1,mean)
print(mu.hat-mu)

#>             [,1]        [,2]
#> [1,] 0.007240035 -0.03916606
Sigma.hat=var(t(x))
print(Sigma.hat-Sigma)

#>            [,1]         [,2]
#> [1,]  0.1458503 -0.042802698
#> [2,] -0.0428027  0.009073944
